arm_group.arm_group_label: Universal coverage of Long Lasting Insecticidal Nets (LLIN)
arm_group.description: Distribution of long lasting insecticidal nets to all community members in the study arm allowing for at least one net per 2 persons

Distribution of long lasting insecticidal nets to all community members in the study arm allowing for at least one net per 2 persons plus indoor residual spraying with insecticide of interior walls of all houses twice yearly.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to determine whether long lasting insecticidal nets and indoor
      residual insecticide spraying, alone or in combination, are effective for controlling
      insecticide resistant anopheles mosquitoes for malaria prevention.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Insecticide Resistance on Vector Control

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will assess the impact that insecticide resistance has on the effectiveness of
      malaria vector control tools LLIN and IRS. This is done by a cluster randomised trials of
      universal coverage LLINs versus universal coverage LLINs in combination with IRS, with
      levels of baseline insecticide resistance in the main vector balanced between the two study
      arms. In each cluster resistance to the insecticide used on LLINs is monitored, and malaria
      incidence is estimated from cluster specific cohorts of children followed up over the
      duration of the study. Resistance impact will be assessed from the ratio of incidence rates
      in clusters with high compared to those with low resistance and from a continuous measure of
      resistance expressed as percentage loss of mosquito mortality when exposed to insecticide in
      standardised WHO tests. Resistance mechanisms will be studied in subsets of study clusters.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children older than 6 months and younger than 10 years in approximately 100 randomly
             selected households in all 140 study clusters selected in the four study areas

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Children living in households within 1 km from the edge of a neighbouring cluster
             (the buffer zone)

intervention.description: Application of insecticide to interior walls of domiciliary structures to kill malaria vector mosquitoes which rest on walls after taking human blood meal

arm_group_label: Universal coverage of Long Lasting Insecticidal Nets (LLIN)
intervention.description: Provision of LLIN to all community members in the clusters allocated to the study arm. LLIN protect individuals from bites by malaria vector mosquitoes by providing a physical barrier and insecticidal and repellent effect.

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Insecticide Resistance in Anopheles Arabiensis on the Effectiveness of Malaria Vector Control in Sudan

overall_official.affiliation: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

primary_outcome.description: Infection with malarial parasites determined by rapid diagnostic tests/microscopy in cohort members who report or have fever (>37.5C)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Infection with plasmodial parasites (falciparum and/or vivax) in randomly selected members of the study cohort in each study cluster during the peak of the malaria transmission season by rapid diagnostic test

Anopheles arabiensis mosquitoes collected in sentinel clusters by light trap, window trap, clay pot and pyrethrum sheet collection and determination of sporozoite, human blood index, feeding and resting behaviour.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average for months Sept, Oct, Nov for years 2011, 2012, 2013

secondary_outcome.description: Molecular analysis of mosquito specimens caught in subset of clusters by pyrethrum spray collection.
secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of insecticide resistance associated genotypes (kdr) in anopheles arabiensis

clinical_study.source: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

lead_sponsor.agency: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
